content.question: Two pucks are free to slide on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. The figure shows a top view of the pucks, one of mass <math alttext="4.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> and one of mass <math alttext="3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math>, before and after they undergo an elastic collision with each other. Before the collision, the <math alttext="4.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> puck slides at <math alttext="6.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and the <math alttext="3.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> puck is at rest. After the collision, the <math alttext="3.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> puck moves with a speed of <math alttext="2.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> at an unknown angle <math alttext="theta sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> measured clockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, as indicated, while the <math alttext="4.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> puck moves at an unknown speed and at an unknown angle <math alttext="theta sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> measured counterclockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, as indicated. What is the speed of the <math alttext="4.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> puck after the elastic collision?
